item.title: Report X-2025030854
item.description:
Report X-2025030854

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-17
  • City: BROOKLYN
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CONTENT INSPECTION NEEDED OF ONE AIR PACKAGE WITH AN INVOICE DESCRIPTION OF 102 IPHONE 14, BUT THE OUTER BOX IS VOID OF ANY DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO INNER BOXES WITH BATTERY MARKS. INSIDE EACH OF THOSE BOXES CONTAINED IPHONES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTERMOST BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2025030182
item.description:
Report E-2025030182

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-14
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 14, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3082's cap was crushed and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the tote exterior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. ES personnel utilized absorbents and containerized all spent material in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew replaced the damaged tote cap.

item.title: Report X-2025030681
item.description:
Report X-2025030681

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-11
  • City: PLATTSBURGH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE IMPRINTED RE-CHARGE BEFORE STORING TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO BATTERY WAS INSPECTED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A ZEROWASTE RAPIDE ECO+ 4IN1 SF6 ECO GAS ANALYSER THAT CONTAINS A NON-SPILLABLE LEAD ACID BATTERY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER CASE. NO INDICATION OF NON-SPILLABLE BATTERY ON THE PELICAN CASE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM NEW YORK USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 8E4A32, THE UPS STORE, 35A SMITHFIELD BLVD, PLATTSBURGH NY 12901-2111.

item.title: Report E-2025030010
item.description:
Report E-2025030010

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-25
  • City: BUFFALO
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: One 02/25/2025, at approximately 12:30 hours, an FRA inspector at the CSX Frontier Yard in Buffalo NY, discovered tank car PROX 35916, load of Liquefied Petroleum Gas, was leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Marathon Petroleum Company, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2025-02-25-00146). EnviroServe, a CSX emergency response contractor, responded and found the cause of the release was the tank car’s liquid line valve was partially open, and secondary closure plug was less than tool tight. Contractor personnel secured the car and verified the release was stopped. The issue identified, and corrective actions, were communicated to the shipper’s representative-John Andersen.

item.title: Report E-2025030249
item.description:
Report E-2025030249

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-17
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1519 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XNW. It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Oxonia Active released from 5-gallon poly pail due to improper loading. The release impacted ITSB-0070. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (Haz Class 5.2) No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallons of UN3109 Oxonia Active product released to an 2’ x3’ area of the trailer floor due to freight not being secured while in transit. The area impacted by oxidizer material was neutralized using Sodium Metabisulfite and areas neutral. The crew used Soda Ash to neutralize the pH. The team observed a pallet with an excavator arm which was also moderately impacted by the spill and neutralized as best as possible. The waste consisted of pails of product was containerized into (1) 55- gallon poly drum, waste product, soda ask, sodium metabisulfite, impacted wood, damaged pail and water was put into (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
